glsa.title: Fetchmail 6.2.5 fixes a remote DoS
glsa.synopsis: Fetchmail versions 6.2.4 and earlier can be crashed by sending a specially-crafted email to a fetchmail user.

background.p: Fetchmail is a utility that retrieves and forwards mail from remote systems using IMAP, POP, and other protocols.

description.p: Fetchmail versions 6.2.4 and earlier can be crashed by sending a specially-crafted email to a fetchmail user. This problem occurs because Fetchmail does not properly allocate memory for long lines in an incoming email.

impact.p: Fetchmail users who receive a malicious email may have their fetchmail program crash.

workaround.p: While a workaround is not currently known for this issue, all users are advised to upgrade to the latest version of fetchmail.
